intro: Lomatogoniopsis, commonly known as the desert broom. It is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features slender, erect stems covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, spikelike inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Lomatogoniopsis is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils with minimal rainfall.
